profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-12-19T09:16-0500

did.abstract: A collection of papers from various generations of the Burr family of Fairfield, CT.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on access to this collection.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Use of the material requires compliance with the Fairfield Museum and History Center regulations.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Item, Collection Title, Collection number (Box #, Folder #). Fairfield Museum and History Center, Fairfield, Connecticut.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: The Burr family settled in Fairfield in the 1600's. The Burrs in this collection were town officials, farmers, storekeepers, sea farers and business people.
Among the more distinguished family members were Thaddeus Burr (1736-1801) at whose house John Hancock was married and Aaron Burr (1756-1836) whose father moved from Fairfield to Newark, NJ.

list.head: Burr Family Members
list.item: Aretta Burr Sherwood (wife of William O.), 1868-1956

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of 23 boxes and 10 oversize items. Box I contains deeds, probate records and writs. The rest of the boxes have been arranged chronologically and by family member where possible. Box II is an assortment of family members.

Box III and V pertain to David Burr and his wife Magdalen while Box IV contains seafaring type materials including Bowditch's Practical Navigator. Box VI contains William Burr's papers and Boxes VII and VIII hold James O. Burr's papers, consisting mostly of letters from "Mame". Box IX has the papers of Josie, David A. and Emma Josephine BUrr.

William O. Burr's papers make up Boxes X and XI and include Fairfield Tercentenary papers as well as a "phrenological character" of W. O. His wife Aretta's papers are in Box XII as are Eunice Dennie Burr and Harry Hill Sherwood. Papers from Lillian Burr's college days at Mt. Holyoke can be found in Boxes XIII and XIV.

Box XV contains Florence Burr Shelton's papers and some photos. Papers belonging to Theodore B., Raymonde Pezard and Theodosia Burr are in Box XVI and include interesting World War I related items. Box XVII is made up of miscellaneous items but of particular note are letters written to Florence A. Wright (Mrs. George Wright) from "Da Da" while both traveled with the Elsie DeWolf theatre company.

Box XVIII holds various account books while Box XIX contains family photos and postcards. Copies of Howard Burr's papers are in Box XX while Box XXI holds Mrs. Frederick A. Burr (Alice) papers. William T. Burr's items, including his Civil Air Patrol papers, are in Box XXII while Fred A. Burr's papers are in Box XXIII.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Other Burr Family material can be found in Ms B24 (letters from World War I), Ms B53 (A DAR scrapbook) and Ms B25 (World War I scrapbook).

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: This collection was processed in January 1988 by Martha Rockwell.

acqinfo.p: Papers from this box come from L87.July.8

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Given by Dr. David H. Burr, President of the Aaron Burr Association, 1987, in honor of Dr. Samuel Engle Burr, Jr. (L88.Jan.1)
